title: Routing in React
description: Navigate between pages without reloading the browser

intro.title: Moving Between Pages
intro.story: A real website has many pages. React needs a way to move between them.
intro.preview: Home, About, Profile without page refresh.

refresher.title: The Problem
refresher.content:
In normal websites:
- Clicking a link reloads the page
- App state is lost
- User experience feels slow

Single Page Apps avoid this.

concept.title: What is Routing?
concept.content:
Routing means:
- Showing different components
- Based on the URL
- Without reloading the page

React uses **react-router-dom**.

concept2.title: Core Components
concept2.content:
- BrowserRouter: Wraps the app
- Routes: Holds all routes
- Route: Single path
- Link: Navigation without reload

positive.title: Simple Routing Example
positive.explanation: URL changes but page does not reload.

concept3.title: Why Use Link?
concept3.content:
`Link` prevents full page reload.

Never use `<a href>` inside React Router apps.
